questions.question: Straw man involves:
questions.explanation: Straw man fallacy misrepresents an opponent's argument to make it easier to attack.

questions.question: Ad hominem targets:
questions.explanation: Ad hominem attacks the person making the argument rather than addressing the argument itself.

questions.question: False dilemma presents:
questions.explanation: False dilemma artificially limits choices to only two options when more exist.

questions.question: Give example of one common fallacy:
questions.explanation: Common fallacies include straw man, slippery slope, ad hominem, false dilemma, and many others.

questions.question: Why does rhetorical appeal often override logical reasoning?
questions.explanation: Rhetorical appeals often override logic because they engage emotions and require less cognitive effort.
